hedline.hl1: Sunni Muslims Settle Suit Against Police

abstract.p: New Jersey Corrections Dept settles federal discrimination suit by 33 Sunni Muslim officers who claim they were in danger of being fired because dept bans beards; ban allows exemptions on religious grounds, but officers have to reapply every year and provide certification from religious leader (S)

block.p: The State Department of Corrections yesterday settled a federal discrimination suit by 33 Sunni Muslim officers who claimed they were in danger of being fired because the department banned beards.

The ban allowed exemptions on religious grounds, but officers had to reapply every year and provide certification from a religious leader, subject to the department's approval. The settlement eliminated the third-party certification, which the officers argued was discriminatory, said their lawyer, Robert Cannan.
